form.official-title: To amend the Adult Education and Family Literacy Act to reserve funds for American Indian, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian, and Tribal College or University adult education and literacy.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Native Adult Education and Literacy Act of 2014.

section.header: American Indian, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian, and Tribal College or University adult education and literacy
section.text: The Adult Education and Family Literacy Act (20 U.S.C. 9201 et seq.) is amended—

section.header: American Indian, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian, and Tribal College or University adult education and literacy

subsection.text: From the amount reserved under section 211(a)(3) for a fiscal year, the Secretary shall award grants to Tribal Colleges or Universities and Native Hawaiian educational organizations—

paragraph.text: to enable the Tribal Colleges or Universities and Native Hawaiian educational organizations to develop and implement innovative, effective, and replicable programs designed to enhance life skills and transition individuals to employability and postsecondary education; and
to provide technical assistance to such colleges, universities, and organizations for program administration.

subsection.text: To be eligible to receive a grant under this section, a Tribal College or University or a Native Hawaiian educational organization shall submit to the Secretary an application at such time and in such manner as the Secretary may reasonably require. The Secretary shall, to the extent practicable, prescribe a simplified and streamlined format for such applications that takes into account the limited number of colleges, universities, and organizations that are eligible for assistance under this section.

Funding shall be awarded under this section to Tribal Colleges or Universities or Native Hawaiian educational organizations on a competitive basis through grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements of not less than 3 years in duration.

In making awards under this section, the Secretary may take into account the considerations set forth in section 231(e). In no case shall the Secretary make an award to a Tribal College or University or Native Hawaiian educational organization that does not include in its application a description of a multiyear strategy, including performance measures, for increasing the number of adult American Indian, Native Hawaiian, or Alaska Natives that attain a secondary school diploma or its recognized equivalent.
Activities that may be carried out under a grant awarded under this section shall include—

paragraph.text: adult education and literacy services, including workplace literacy services;
English literacy programs, including limited English proficiency programs;
opportunities for American Indians, Native Hawaiians, and Alaska Natives to qualify for a secondary school diploma, or its recognized equivalent; and

demonstration and research projects and professional development activities designed to develop and identify the most successful methods and techniques for addressing the educational needs of American Indian, Native Hawaiian, and Alaska Native adults.

subsection.header: Definition of Native Hawaiian educational organization
subsection.text: The term Native Hawaiian educational organization means a private nonprofit organization that—

paragraph.text: serves the adult education and literacy needs and interests of Native Hawaiians;
has demonstrated expertise in the education or training of Native Hawaiian children, youth, or adults; and
has demonstrated expertise in research and program development.
